channel.description: Recent content in NBA on Braxton Wolfes Sports Blog

item.title: How NBA Back To Backs Impact Performanace
item.description: Victor Wembanyama was regarded as the best prospect to enter the NBA since Lebron James over two decades ago. A primary reason for this was his elite two way ability, specifically his ability to impact the defensive side of the ball at a level we do not see in the NBA today. While a lot of that defensive hype he has gotten is because of his extraordinary size, there are plenty of other key factors and areas that Wembanyama thrives in to make his impact felt so much on the basketball court.

item.title: NBA Back-to-Back Analysis
item.description:
Introduction

The NBA has one of the more rigorous schedules in all of sports. With there being so many games in a season, back to backs are critical to get an entire season to fit in the window of time that they have. Even though they are necessary, back to backs have caught quite a bit of flack from the audience and the effect it has on the game. We are going to dive into the data on back to backs in the NBA and see how they affect teams play, while comparing it to their other performances with rest involved.
